occupation: Co-Founder at Power to the Brand (YC W22)
headline: Co-Founder at Power to the Brand (YC W22)
summary:
(31 Jul 2023) Are interested in running groupbuys / group pre-orders for Singapore & Indonesia? Hit me up at founders@powertothebrand.sg!

- - -
In 20 years' time, we'll regret the things we didn't do, more than the things we did. I seek a purposeful life – chasing world's hardest problems and solving for them. 

A lawyer by training, an entrepreneur at heart and what Jeff Lawson describes as a "software person", I've currently devoted the next 10 years of my life to building infrastructure for shift of global commerce to a seamless online-offline future.

experiences.title: Co-Founder
experiences.description:
• Backed by Y Combinator
• We help high value brands simplify local retail distribution across SE Asia. We reduce market entry complexity across SE Asia by building shared infrastructure

experiences.title: Founder
experiences.description:
• Grew a niche retail, distribution and corporate orders business from $0 to $350,000 annual revenues as a 1 man business
• Turned down two acquisition offers, doubling the business each time after
• Acquired by Power to the Brand

experiences.title: Associate
experiences.description:
• Distilled and summarized key clauses in a series of movie production contracts (spanning from financing to cast agreements). 
• Published an IPO process/requirements summary (covering both Mainboard and Catalist) for a Singapore Business Federation publication article.
• Drafted court submissions for a chambers hearing involving a defamation matter.
• Drafted financing agreements and client update emails for commercial property financing matters.
• Prepared legal research memorandums relating to ad-hoc commercial issues.

experiences.title: Bartender's Assistant
experiences.description:
• Learned to endure hard work for minimum pay 
• Learned THE optimal way to peel oranges

experiences.title: Operations Assistant
experiences.description: • Planned and set up events and event venues

experiences.title: Intern
experiences.description:
• Distilled MAS Anti-Money Laundering Notices as applicable to different financial institutions into a presentation to key clients’ senior management
• Learnt to have the courage to speak up - the managing partner asked a question which I knew the answer to, but I was too timid. That defining moment probably cost me an immediate job offer

experiences.title: Intern at Banking Practice
experiences.description: • Drafting & proofreading agreements for the a REIT's IPO on the SGX. A LOT of drafting and proofreading.
